text: Who are the authors mentioned at the beginning of 1 Thessalonians?
verseText: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, To the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace.

text: Paul commends the Thessalonian believers for receiving the word with joy despite what?
verseText: And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, for you received the word in much affliction, with the joy of the Holy Spirit,

text: In 1 Thessalonians 2, Paul defends his ministry among them, emphasizing that it was NOT characterized by what?
options: Flattery, greed, or seeking glory from people
verseText: For we never came with words of flattery, as you know, nor with a pretext for greed—God is witness. Nor did we seek glory from people, whether from you or from others, though we could have made demands as apostles of Christ.

text: Who did Paul send back to Thessalonica to establish and exhort the believers in their faith when he couldn't go himself?
verseText: Therefore when we could bear it no longer, we were willing to be left behind at Athens alone, and we sent Timothy, our brother and God's coworker in the gospel of Christ, to establish and exhort you in your faith,

text: What is the main topic Paul addresses in 1 Thessalonians 4:13-18?
options: The return of Christ and the fate of believers who have died
verseText: But we do not want you to be uninformed, brothers, about those who are asleep, that you may not grieve as others do who have no hope... For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a cry of command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the sound of the trumpet of God. And the dead in Christ will rise first. Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air...

text: How does Paul say the Day of the Lord will come (1 Thessalonians 5)?
options: Like a thief in the night
Only after the Temple is rebuilt
verseText: For you yourselves are fully aware that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.

text: Since believers are 'children of light', how should they live in anticipation of the Day of the Lord (1 Thessalonians 5)?
options: Sober and alert, putting on faith, love, and hope
verseText: For you are all children of light, children of the day. We are not of the night or of the darkness. So then let us not sleep, as others do, but let us keep awake and be sober... But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, having put on the breastplate of faith and love, and for a helmet the hope of salvation.

text: What short, practical instructions does Paul give in 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18?
options: Work hard, save money, build houses
Judge fairly, show mercy, walk humbly
Rejoice always, pray without ceasing, give thanks in all circumstances
Study Scripture, attend church, obey leaders
verseText: Rejoice always, pray without ceasing, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.

text: What does Paul instruct the Thessalonians NOT to quench (1 Thessalonians 5:19)?
verseText: Do not quench the Spirit.

text: Paul encourages the Thessalonians regarding sanctification (holy living), specifically urging them to abstain from what in chapter 4?
verseText: For this is the will of God, your sanctification: that you abstain from sexual immorality;

text: Paul remembers the Thessalonians' work produced by faith, labor prompted by love, and endurance inspired by what?
options: Hope in our Lord Jesus Christ
verseText: We remember before our God and Father your work of faith and labor of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.

text: How did the gospel come to the Thessalonians, according to Paul?
options: Not only in word, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction
verseText: because our gospel came to you not only in word, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction. You know what kind of men we proved to be among you for your sake.

text: The Thessalonians became imitators of Paul, his companions, and whom else?
verseText: And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, for you received the word in much affliction, with the joy of the Holy Spirit,

text: The Thessalonians' faith became known everywhere, so much so that Paul didn't need to say anything. What specific change in their lives was reported?
options: They turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God
verseText: For they themselves report concerning us the kind of reception we had among you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God,

text: Besides serving the living God, what else were the Thessalonians waiting for from heaven?
options: His Son, whom He raised from the dead
verseText: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, Jesus who delivers us from the wrath to come.

text: Paul reminds the Thessalonians that his visit was not a failure, even though he had previously suffered and been shamefully treated where?
verseText: But though we had already suffered and been shamefully treated at Philippi, as you know, we had boldness in our God to declare to you the gospel of God in the midst of much conflict.

text: Paul compares his gentle care for the Thessalonians to what?
options: A nursing mother taking care of her own children
verseText: But we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother taking care of her own children.

text: Why did Paul and his companions work night and day while preaching the gospel to the Thessalonians?
options: So that they might not be a burden to any of them
verseText: For you remember, brothers, our labor and toil: we worked night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you, while we proclaimed to you the gospel of God.

text: Paul also compares his interaction with the Thessalonians to how a father deals with his children, doing what?
options: Exhorting, encouraging, and charging them to walk worthily of God
verseText: For you know how, like a father with his children, we exhorted each one of you and encouraged you and charged you to walk in a manner worthy of God, who calls you into his own kingdom and glory.

text: How did the Thessalonians accept the word of God they heard from Paul?
options: Not as the word of men but as it really is, the word of God
verseText: And we also thank God constantly for this, that when you received the word of God, which you heard from us, you accepted it not as the word of men but as what it really is, the word of God, which is at work in you believers.

text: The Thessalonian church became imitators of the churches of God in Judea by suffering from whom?
verseText: For you, brothers, became imitators of the churches of God in Christ Jesus that are in Judea. For you suffered the same things from your own countrymen as they did from the Jews,

text: Who does Paul say hindered him from visiting the Thessalonians again?
verseText: because we wanted to come to you—I, Paul, again and again—but Satan hindered us.

text: What does Paul call the Thessalonian believers in anticipation of Christ's return?
options: His hope, joy, and crown of boasting
verseText: For what is our hope or joy or crown of boasting before our Lord Jesus at his coming? Is it not you?

text: Paul sent Timothy to the Thessalonians so that no one would be moved by what?
verseText: that no one be moved by these afflictions. For you yourselves know that we are destined for this.

text: What good news did Timothy bring back from Thessalonica that greatly encouraged Paul?
options: News of their faith and love
That the church had grown wealthy
That they had built a large building
verseText: But now that Timothy has come to us from you, and has brought us the good news of your faith and love and reported that you always remember us kindly and long to see us, as we long to see you—

text: Paul prays that the Lord would make the Thessalonians increase and abound in what towards one another and all people?
verseText: and may the Lord make you increase and abound in love for one another and for all, as we do for you,

text: The goal of abounding in love is so that God may establish their hearts blameless in holiness before Him at what event?
options: The coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints
verseText: so that he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.

text: Paul urges the Thessalonians to walk and please God, just as they received instruction from him, and to do this how?
verseText: Finally, then, brothers, we ask and urge you in the Lord Jesus, that as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God, just as you are doing, that you do so more and more.

text: Regarding sanctification, each believer should know how to control their own body in what manner?
verseText: that each one of you know how to control his own body in holiness and honor,

text: Believers should not control their bodies in the 'passion of lust' like whom?
options: The Gentiles who do not know God
verseText: not in the passion of lust like the Gentiles who do not know God;

text: What warning does Paul give regarding wronging or defrauding a brother in the matter of sexual immorality?
options: The Lord is an avenger in all these things
It only affects the individuals involved
verseText: that no one transgress and wrong his brother in this matter, because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, as we told you beforehand and solemnly warned you.

text: God has called believers not for impurity, but for what?
verseText: For God has not called us for impurity, but in holiness.

text: Therefore, whoever disregards the teaching on sanctification disregards not man, but whom?
options: God, who gives His Holy Spirit
verseText: Therefore whoever disregards this, disregards not man but God, who gives his Holy Spirit to you.

text: Paul encourages the Thessalonians to aspire to live quietly, mind their own affairs, and do what else?
verseText: and to aspire to live quietly, and to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you,

text: Living quietly and working enables believers to walk properly before whom and be dependent on no one?
verseText: so that you may walk properly before outsiders and be dependent on no one.

text: Paul doesn't want believers to be uninformed about 'those who are asleep' (the dead in Christ) so that they don't grieve like whom?
verseText: But we do not want you to be uninformed, brothers, about those who are asleep, that you may not grieve as others do who have no hope.

text: What is the basis for the belief that God will bring with Jesus those who have fallen asleep?
options: The belief that Jesus died and rose again
verseText: For since we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so, through Jesus, God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep.

text: When the Lord descends, who will rise first?
verseText: For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a cry of command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the sound of the trumpet of God. And the dead in Christ will rise first.

text: What will happen to the believers who are alive and left at the Lord's coming?
options: They will be caught up together with the risen dead in the clouds
They will establish an earthly kingdom
verseText: Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air, and so we will always be with the Lord.

text: What are the believers instructed to do with the words about Christ's return?
verseText: Therefore encourage one another with these words.

text: Regarding the times and seasons of the Lord's return, what does Paul say?
options: He says they have no need to be written to, as they know the Day comes like a thief
He refers them to Old Testament prophets
verseText: Now concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need to have anything written to you. For you yourselves are fully aware that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.

text: When people are saying 'Peace and security', what will happen?
options: Sudden destruction will come upon them
A time of prosperity will begin
verseText: While people are saying, “There is peace and security,” then sudden destruction will come upon them as labor pains come upon a pregnant woman, and they will not escape.

text: God has not destined believers for wrath, but for what?
options: Obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ
verseText: For God has not destined us for wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,

text: What should believers do for those who labor among them and are over them in the Lord?
options: Respect them and esteem them very highly in love
verseText: We ask you, brothers, to respect those who labor among you and are over you in the Lord and admonish you, and to esteem them very highly in love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.

text: Paul urges the believers to admonish the idle, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, and be what toward all?
verseText: And we urge you, brothers, admonish the idle, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, be patient with them all.

text: What should believers ensure no one repays another with?
verseText: See that no one repays anyone evil for evil, but always seek to do good to one another and to everyone.

text: Regarding prophecies, what should believers NOT do, while also testing everything?
verseText: Do not despise prophecies, but test everything; hold fast what is good.

text: What should believers abstain from?
verseText: Abstain from every form of evil.

text: Paul prays that the God of peace Himself will sanctify the Thessalonians completely, keeping their spirit, soul, and body blameless until when?
options: The coming of our Lord Jesus Christ
verseText: Now may the God of peace himself sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

text: What assurance does Paul give regarding God, who calls the believers?
options: He is faithful; He will surely do it (complete their sanctification)
verseText: He who calls you is faithful; he will surely do it.
